oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertising card for Joy’s Flowers, 1929
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A blue advertising card for Joy’s Flowers, featuring a happy cartoon elephant printed in black ink. She is walking on her hind legs and wears a dress and earring. She carries a bouquet of flowers twisted in her trunk and is smiling broadly over her shoulder. Above the bouquet is a small banner reading: “From Joy’s”. A poem appears beneath the elephant, promoting Joy’s Flowers. Joy Floral Company was the oldest florist in Nashville, established in 1877 by Canadian immigrants Thomas C. Joy and his father, Thomas S. Joy. At the time of this ad, their main retail location was at 601 Church Street. Forms part of the Businesses Ephemera Subject Files. 1 advertising card ; col. ; 3 x 6 in.
